class.name: G4MFNode4D
class.brief_description: Node in the G4MF scene hierarchy.
class.description: G4MFNode4D represents all nodes in a G4MF file. All G4MF nodes have a transform, have an array of child nodes, and may have other data set on them.

method.name: apply_to_godot_node
method.description: Sets the name, transform, visibility, and extras of the given [Node4D] to match this [G4MFNode4D].

method.name: from_dictionary
method.description: Converts the given [Dictionary] representing the JSON of a G4MF node to a [G4MFNode4D]. This will set the fields of the [G4MFNode4D] and [G4MFItem4D] classes based on the data in the [Dictionary].

method.name: from_godot_node
method.description: Converts the given [Node] into a [G4MFNode4D]. This will set the fields of the [G4MFNode4D] based on the data in the [Node] for physics nodes, mesh instance nodes, and camera nodes. For all 4D nodes, this will set the transform and visibility. For all nodes, this will set the name and extras as handled by [G4MFItem4D].

method.name: get_scene_node_path
method.description: Returns the [NodePath] that will correspond to the generated [Node4D] in the Godot scene tree that this [G4MFNode4D] will generate.

method.name: import_generate_godot_node
method.description: Generates a [Node4D] from the G4MF node data. This will consider all fields of the [G4MFNode4D] except for the [member children_indices] and [member parent_index] properties, since this does not traverse the G4MF hierarchy to generate descendant nodes. This function also does not consider any additional data provided by extensions, only the base G4MF node data. To generate a full scene and handle extensions, use [G4MFDocument4D.import_generate_godot_scene] to generate a complete scene from the [G4MFState] data. The [param g4mf_state] parameter is used to access [G4MFShape4D] objects when generating physics shapes, and to access [G4MFMesh4D] and [G4MFMaterial4D] objects when generating meshes. The [param p_scene_parent] parameter is only used when generating physics nodes.

method.name: to_dictionary
method.description: Converts the G4MF node to a [Dictionary]. This is used for serializing the G4MF node as JSON.

members.member: The local (parent-relative) transformation basis of this [G4MFNode4D], representing rotation and scale.
The camera of this [G4MFNode4D]. If this node is not a camera, this is [code]null[/code].
The indices of the child nodes of this [G4MFNode4D]. Each index refers to the index of a [G4MFNode4D] in the [member G4MFState4D.g4mf_nodes] array.
The light of this [G4MFNode4D]. If this node is not a light, this is [code]null[/code].

The mesh instance of this [G4MFNode4D]. If this node is not a mesh instance, this is [code]null[/code]. If this node is a mesh instance, this will be a valid [G4MFMeshInstance4D] which references a valid [G4MFMesh4D] in the [G4MFState4D] and may reference a [G4MFMaterial4D] as well.

The model instance of this [G4MFNode4D]. If this node is not a model instance, this is [code]null[/code]. If this node is a model instance, this will be a valid [G4MFModelInstance4D] which references a valid [G4MFModel4D] in the [G4MFState4D]. Model instances are used to create entire hierarchies of nodes, such as from an embedded G4MF file.
The index of the parent node of this [G4MFNode4D]. This is the index of a [G4MFNode4D] in the [member G4MFState4D.g4mf_nodes] array. If this is the root node, this is [code]-1[/code].

The physics data of this [G4MFNode4D]. If this node is not a physics node, this is [code]null[/code]. This contains information about the physical motion, collider shape, and trigger shape of this node.
The local (parent-relative) position of this [Node4D]. This is the same as [code]transform.origin[/code].
The local (parent-relative) scale of this [Node4D]. This is the length of each basis vector.

Whether this [G4MFNode4D] is visible. This affects if 4D meshes are rendered or not, and affects all descendants of this node. The visibility of a node in the tree is determined by its own [member visible] property and the visibility of all its ancestors.
